alert.note: Alert for Okfuskee; Okmulgee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 04 at 8:42PM CDT until May 04 at 11:45PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR OKFUSKEE AND SOUTHWESTERN OKMULGEE COUNTIES... At 842 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing with life threatening flash flooding likely developing. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Okemah... Okfuskee... Henryetta... Boley... Paden... Bearden... Castle... Clearview... Welty... Pharoah... Okmulgee State Park... Mason... FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
